channel.title: Code Sermon.org
channel.itunes:author: preacher@codesermon.org
channel.itunes:subtitle: Preaching Best Practices - A podcast for software developers.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 20: Reference Counting
item.description: Some thoughts on managing object lifetimes using reference counting

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 19: Picking Libraries
item.description: Finding the right library for your project

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 18: Release Mode Debugging
item.description: Debugging when you can't use the debugger

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 17: Premature Optimization
item.description: Optimize your code. But not that code.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 16: Constants
item.description: A Constant is just a Variable that doesn't Vary.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 15: Loops
item.description: Your computer is probably looping right now.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 14: Strings
item.description: They're not as simple as you think they are.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 13: Concurrency
item.description: The best way to make your code faster.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 12: Naming Conventions
item.description: Thinking about what to call things.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 11: Platforms
item.description: Where you want to run your software dictates how you write it.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 10: Robustness
item.description: Code Sermon on Robustness. Writing code that isn't environmentally sensitive.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 9: Warnings
item.description: Code Sermon on compiler warnings. Your compiler is trying to tell you something. Are you listening?.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 8: Memory Management
item.description: Code Sermon on memory management. Differences between garbage collected languages and C and C++. Also a bit about locality.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 7: Post Deployment
item.description: Code Sermon on post-deployment. Stuff you should have done before you released your code.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 6: Error Handling
item.description: Code Sermon on Error Handling. Exceptions or error codes. Logging. The importance of giving your users the information they need to fix the problems they run into.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 5: Deployment
item.description: Code Sermon on Deployment. Thoughts on getting the software you've written from your computer onto the computers of your users.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 4: Optimizations
item.description: When not to optimize, when to optimize, and some thoughts on how to approach it.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 3: Application UI Responsiveness
item.description: If you can't be fast, seem fast. This sermon talks about ways to make your application feel responsive in cases where many apps leave the user wondering what's up.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 2: File IO
item.description: Reading and writing files is easy, right? Here's some sins that developers often commit when reading and writing files.

item.title: Code Sermon, Episode 1: Software Testing
item.description: Testing your software should be done while you're writing your software, not after it. Talks about unit testing, test driven development, and more.
